intro: Howardia smilacina, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a climbing plant characterized by its dark green, heart-shaped leaves that are often glossy and have a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens for its attractive foliage.
